Feb 4 - Investment company 3i Infrastructure has increased its credit facilities to £1bn, providing the company with liquidity to make further investments.

In December, the company received credit approval to increase its sustainability-linked revolving credit facility to £600m from £400m through a £200m accordion.

In January, 3i agreed an additional £400m one-year credit facility from existing lenders.

The RCF, which was originally arranged in November, has a three-year maturity with two one-year extension options and pays 150bp over Sonia.

The RCF was arranged by Barclays and ICBC alongside Lloyds, NatWest, NAB, Royal Bank of Canada, SEB and SMBC. Lloyds is facility agent.

The sustainability-linked RCF is aligned to the Loan Market Association’s Sustainability Linked Loan Principles, and the margin adjusts depending on 3i Infrastructure’s performance against ESG targets.

All 3i Infrastructure portfolio companies are implementing sustainability strategies developed in 2020 and are gathering greenhouse gas emissions data.

(Editing by Chris Mangham)
